page.title: 17THE SITE OF ORMSKIRK
page.content: Although not very high above sea level, Ormskirk is relatively higher than the plain surrounding it.The early site was on a sandstone outcrop overlooking the low land to the west. To the east the land was relatively level therefore this provided at dry commanding view of the surroundings. On a clear day from the top of the parish church you can see for miles. To the north you can easily see the Ribble estuary and the large town of Preston 20 miles away and on very clear days you can see to the Lake District Fells and the Langdale Mountains. To the west and the north west you can see Southport and in the winter on a clear night you can see the illuminations at Blackpool.
